Method Detail

getDescription

java.lang.String getDescription()
Describes the type of document.
returns:
A descriptive String.

getId

java.lang.String getId()
Gets identifier for this type of document.
returns:
The identifying String.

isValid

boolean isValid()
Generically, this method determines if the document in question is valid according to some classification. Since this implementation is for a default classification that knows nothing about the structure of the document in question, it always returns false.
throws:
Exception if no document has been defined.

setDocument

void setDocument(java.io.File doc)
Defines the document this type applies to.
Parameters:
doc - The document we're classifying, as a File.

setLanguageWritingCharset

void setLanguageWritingCharset(LanguageWritingCharset langWritingChars)
Defines the LanguageWritingCharset component of this document.
Parameters:
langWritingChars - A LanguageWritingCharset object defining properties and behaviors of this document.

writeTokenUrns

void writeTokenUrns(java.lang.String outputFileName)
Uses default configuration to tokenize the document. First creates a tabulated representation of the source, then
throws:
Exception if either document or accompanying TextInventory is undefined, or if document cannot be tabulated.
Parameters:
outputFileName - Name of file to write in this.workDir.

writeTokenUrns

void writeTokenUrns(java.io.File outputTokens)
